attributes.action: Government intervention in the governance of football by the EFL
attributes.additional_details: Many clubs have already been damaged irreparably by the EFL’s bizarre decision making. Tranmere were arbitrarily demoted & suffered multi-million £ losses. Bury were expelled entirely from the league. Other clubs unfairly benefitted from getting a promotion or extra funding to compete in play offs. Now Wigan are in administration & face a bleak future. This maladministration at the top of the game cannot be allowed to continue or else the the world’s oldest league could be permanently destroyed.
attributes.background: The EFL is out of control: Bury, Bolton, Macclesfield, PPG & now Wigan just to name a few. The current governance of the sport is a fiasco, and it’s only time before other clubs are failed by the EFL. Football needs external help if it is to survive the EFL’s disastrous administration.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand you want Government intervention in football, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
